image.altText: An adult and a child walking across a pedestrian crossing in a school zone, with the bonnet of a car in the left foreground.

props.synopsis: Canberra mother Veronica Fortune says the road past her local school is an accident waiting to happen. She's written to MLAs about safety improvements and campaigned for adjustments to the roads, but so far nothing has changed.

title.children: Would you accept a 30kph school zone speed limit?

image.altText: A man with short dark hair in a navy suit and tie looks down at a smartphone as he walks out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The trial of a man accused of committing sexual offences against an 11-year-old girl hears he used dating app Badoo to speak and meet with her, and later arranged to meet up with her to have sex.

title.children: 'Tell no-one': Man met 11yo alleged victim on dating app, court hears

image.altText: A man wearing a white button down shirt, black jeans and large sunglasses walks out of a court building holding papers.

props.synopsis: Canberra 28-year-old Jett Black, who was among a group of detainees that in late 2020 started a prison riot sparked by a lack of cigarettes, no dessert and COVID restrictions, walks free from court.

title.children: Canberra man told to 'make different friends' in prison riot sentencing

image.altText: Seven teenage boys stand in a circle on an outdoor basketball court listening to a man in a white beanie speaking.

props.synopsis: Menslink workshops are helping young men tackle harmful social expectations, loneliness and anger, by stirring up the toxicity "all around them" and encouraging them to decide what sort of men they want to be.

title.children: Confidential sessions challenging 'toxic' masculinity in teen boys

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Depraved and violent torture is how an ACT Supreme Court judge described the actions of a brother found guilty of sexually abusing his two sisters over several years, as he was sentenced to over 16 years in jail.

title.children: Canberra judge jails brother for 'depraved' abuse of sisters

image.altText: A rabbit outside Parliament House

props.synopsis: Rabbits were introduced to Australia during colonisation, with 'plagues' causing widespread environmental, agricultural and economic destruction. Nowadays the pest is controlled using biocontrol, but experts say without funding the population could soon be out of control.

title.children: The ACT could be looking down the burrow of a rabbit plague

image.altText: Two skiers, with backs to the camera, at the top of a mountain beside a ski lift.

props.synopsis: Towns in the Snowy Mountains rely on tourist dollars during winter, but as the cost of living bites, Aussies are looking for ways to enjoy snow holidays on a budget.

title.children: How Aussies are affording a 'bloody expensive' trip to the snow

image.altText: A female newsreader in Islamic head dress has a panicked look on her place

props.synopsis: A news anchor in Tehran is seen fleeing a TV studio as Israel and Iran launch missile strikes at each other as the conflict enters its fifth day.

title.children: Israelis vow Iran 'cannot break us' as Iranian state TV bombed live on air

image.altText: A green ceramic mug sits beside an open laptop displaying a conference call with a group of colleagues.

props.synopsis: Business groups say those who work from home should not expect to receive overtime and penalty rates if they have the flexibility to choose their own hours.

title.children: Union wants 'presumed' right to work from home, as Labor weighs new law

image.altText: Four people stand inside a big cave.

props.synopsis: Deep in the Blue Mountains, archaeologists uncover artefacts that reveal secrets of the nation's Ice Age past.

title.children: Hidden in a Blue Mountains cave are artefacts that change the story of a nation

image.altText: CCTV footage of a shooting in an Auburn kebab shop

props.synopsis: Employees can be seen ducking for cover as their target, crime boss Samimjan Azari, tries to dodge a hail of bullets from behind a chair.

title.children: Video shows the moment gunmen stormed Sydney kebab shop

image.altText: The hands of a person counting through piles of $100 US dollar notes

props.synopsis: Has America's descent into authoritarianism destroyed its reputation permanently?

title.children: Why global money is abandoning America

image.altText: Man in a yellow shirt holding up a phone showing a photo of an older Indian woman with her grandchild.

props.synopsis: Imtiaz Ali Syed still can't bring himself to tell his mother that his brother was on board the Air India flight which crashed while taking off from Ahmedabad.

title.children: AI171 incinerated everything in its path. It means an agonising wait for families

image.altText: Composite image of three screenshots of profiles on Instagram

props.synopsis: Racist comments mocking the victims flooded social media after the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad.

title.children: Indians 'shocked' by flood of racist slurs after 241 died in Air India crash

image.altText: A small possum superimposed over a black background, showing a handdrawn aerial map

props.synopsis: A Victorian timber company is using what's been dubbed a "zombie" license from 1977 to log critically endangered mountain ash forest, including the habitat of the Leadbeater's possum, which was once thought extinct.

title.children: 'Zombie' permit from 1977 used to log endangered possum habitat

image.altText: Christine and her daughter Mia hug each other outside the front of their home.

props.synopsis: The proportion of Australian teenagers vaccinated against the virus that causes cervical cancer is the lowest it has been in almost 10 years.

title.children: Poor vaccine uptake a 'reality check' as situation worsening in Australia

image.altText: Exterior of Cairns Courthouse building.

props.synopsis: A man has faced court on charges including deprivation of liberty and torture after a woman was found with a shaved head and severe bruising in Cairns.

title.children: Second person charged over alleged kidnapping and torture of 19yo woman

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: Australians could see petrol prices rise as high as $2.20 a litre, as analysts warn the spike in oil prices fuelled by the Israel-Iran conflict will flow "directly to the pump".

title.children: Warnings interest rate cuts could be delayed if oil price surge continues

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: One of the doctors accused of playing a role in Matthew Perry's death is expected to change his plea to guilty, admitting he injected the actor with ketamine on several occasions in the weeks leading up to his death.

title.children: Doctor admits injecting Matthew Perry with ketamine in exchange for cash

image.altText: A dark skinned man wearing black sunglasses with pursed lips

props.synopsis: Prosecutors showed videos at the heart of the case that the hip-hop mogul recorded during day-long, drug-fuelled sessions.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial shown 'freak-off' sex marathon videos

image.altText: Alexander's daughter in the snow

props.synopsis: While the weather might be drastically different in Tasmania and the NT during winter, the social calendar is equally busy.

title.children: The magic of winter in Tasmania, and the 'chill' in Darwin

image.altText: A crowd of mostly men lean on a fence, holding pots and buckets.

props.synopsis: Israeli troops kill at least 23 Gazans waiting for food at an aid distribution site in Rafah, medics say.

title.children: Families mourn loved ones seeking food killed by Israeli forces at Gaza relief centre

image.altText: A close up of a sunscreen bottle.

props.synopsis: Peak consumer group Choice has defended its sunscreen testing and publicly released all tests in the face of criticism about its methods.

title.children: Choice doubles down on its sunscreen testing in the face of fierce criticism

image.altText: Two women hug

props.synopsis: Advocates say a critical undersupply of housing has forced people onto the streets. But as more councils disperse homeless camps, rough sleepers are left with nowhere to go.

title.children: Housing crisis forces retiree out onto the streets to help the homeless

image.altText: Two women sit on an unfinished deck outside a converted shed. They are looking at the camera with neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Anastasia and Lexie Gunn say their two younger children were conceived using a different sperm donor to their eldest boy, even though they requested the same donor be used in all three cases.

title.children: Couple ask government for 'advocacy' amid dispute with IVF giant

image.altText: Bronte from Netflix's The Survivors faces the camera on a Tasmanian beach lined with bush.

props.synopsis: Netflix’s new series once again puts toxic masculinity in the spotlight. But this time, it has a uniquely Australian flavour.

title.children: The Survivors turns Jane Harper's novel into a crime show with grit

image.altText: a man in a muddy jacket is held by armed police in tactical gear

props.synopsis: The man charged with killing one Minnesota politician and wounding another visited the homes of other Democrats on his alleged hit list, according to prosecutors.

title.children: Accused Minnesota assassin stalked homes of two other Democrats, prosecutors say

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A man has been found guilty of murdering his housemate by setting him on fire at their home in Adelaide's west in 2021.

title.children: Man who set housemate on fire found guilty of murder

image.altText: Cameron Smith hugs Cameron Munster

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster hopes to mirror his legendary former club and Maroons captain Cameron Smith as he leads Queensland out for the first time this week.

title.children: Munster, Maroons hoping to summon the spirit of 'generational' Smith to square Origin ledger

image.altText: A rainbow flag waving outside of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The NT government has walked back on its plans to scrap hate speech protections in the territory's anti-discrimination laws. However there are still fears the changes will "water down" laws against vilification.

title.children: NT government accused of 'watering down' anti-discrimination laws

image.altText: A close up image of leanne akrap

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old man has been charged with the murder of a 47-year-old woman whose body was discovered in bushland in Werrington on the weekend.

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman's body found in Sydney bushland

image.altText: A line up of weights on racks in a gym.

props.synopsis: Illegal steroid use is on the rise among female bodybuilders, a study finds, but a lack of "steroid literacy" is making them vulnerable to its harmful side effects.

title.children: More young women are bodybuilding — and risking it with steroids

image.altText: Daniel sitting in a dimly lit room. A stream of light shines through the window blinds on his eye.

props.synopsis: An "overworked and under-resourced" state agency, the WA Public Trustee, is facing fresh allegations of overcharging a vulnerable woman to manage her assets while doing little to no work. The agency is set to face public scrutiny in a parliamentary committee hearing.

title.children: State charges woman with dementia $137k while managing assets at a loss

image.altText: Jack Sinclair wipes his nose with his jumper

props.synopsis: St Kilda and a number of other clubs are stuck in AFL no-mans land, the worst place to be as Tasmania gets set to enter the competition, and they must embrace youth before it is too late.

title.children: AFL clubs must pick a lane or risk being left behind after expansion

image.altText: A bearded man standing with blue sky behind him looks ominously back over his shoulder

props.synopsis: The Australian director of Dangerous Animals always loved Jaws, but felt like the animals were hard done by. In his new Gold Coast-set shark thriller, they're not the bad guys.

title.children: This Australian-made shark thriller is pointedly scary and quotably funny
